lead_paragraph: The state has voted for the G.O.P. candidate in the past nine presidential elections, but Donald J. Trump may have created an opening for Mrs. Clinton.

byline.contributor: David Montgomery contributed reporting from Austin, Tex.

headline.print_headline: Cautious Optimism About Clinton’s Texas Chances
headline.main: Could Hillary Clinton Win Texas? Some Democrats Say Maybe

snippet: The state has voted for the G.O.P. candidate in the past nine presidential elections, but Donald J. Trump may have created an opening for Mrs. Clinton....
abstract: Some Democrats in Texas are cautiously optimistic about possibility that Hillary Clinton could win state, despite fact that state's voters have chosen Republican for White House in past nine presidential elections; number of polls have shown state is competitive, and combination of changing demographics and investment by Clinton campaign could tilt scales against Donald Trump.
